subject: Re: different results between swingui and textui runner
msgSnippet: ... a guess. ... Here s the test class. The login() method does start up an orbix daemon to make some RPC calls. I just realized that this daemon is never
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> mjz115 wrote:
>
> > I've written a simple test case that successfully runs using the
> > textui test runner. When I attempt to run the same exact test using
> > the swingui or awtui test runner, I get a NullPointerException. Can
> > anyone explain what might be different about the jvm, classloader, or
> > environment when using the swingui.TestRunner? Unfortunately, my class
> > is not the one spewing out the exception so I can't use source code to
> > see what's going on.
>
> Show us the test, including any relevant setUp() method. I'm going to
> guess that you're changing the test name somehow... but that's just
a guess.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand

Here's the test class. The login() method does start up an orbix
daemon to make some RPC calls. I just realized that this daemon is
never created through the swingui.TestRunner.

/*
* Created on May 24, 2004
*
* To change the template for this generated file go to
* Window>Preferences>Java>Code Generation>Code and Comments
*/
package com.ugs.tceng.test;

import com.ugs.tceng.TestLogin;
import junit.framework.TestCase;

/**
* @author mzawacki
*
* To change the template for this generated type comment go to
* Window>Preferences>Java>Code Generation>Code and Comments
*/
public class TestLoginTest extends TestCase {

/**
* Constructor for TestLoginTest.
* @param arg0
*/
public TestLoginTest(String arg0) {
super(arg0);
}

/*
* @see TestCase#setUp()
*/
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
super.setUp();
}

/*
* @see TestCase#tearDown()
*/
protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
super.tearDown();
}

public void testLogin() {
TestLogin.login ();
}

public void testNewFolder() {
TestLogin.login ();
TestLogin.createFolder("testFolder");
}

}
